description: Least d for which the number with continued fraction [n,n,n,n...] is in Q(sqrt(d)).
comments: Square roots of a(n) are found in the limiting ratios of A000045, A001333, A003688, A015448, A015449, A015451 and so on. I.e., the limiting ratios are the golden ratio, silver mean, bronze ratio and so on. - _Mats Granvik_, Oct 20 2010
links: Clark Kimberling, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..1000
mathematica: z = 5000; u = Table[{p, e} = Transpose[FactorInteger[n]];Times @@ (p^Mod[e, 2]), {n, z}]; Table[u[[n^2 + 4]], {n, 1, Sqrt[z - 4]}]  (* _Clark Kimberling_, Jul 20 2015, based on _T. D. Noe_'s program at A007913 *)
crossrefs: a(n) = 2 is equivalent to "n is in the sequence A077444", a(n) = 5 is equivalent to "n is in the sequence A002878".
author: _Clark Kimberling_
